html:
Next morning, just a normal day in a small town called Dayswen.

“Please don’t ever do this again.”

“What do you mean? I saved him.”

“You put yourself in danger for a random stranger, milady. That is not acceptable.”

“But… the other method would be too late.”

“Our objective was to slay the Hellspawn haunting this area, not risking your life over a ‘nobody’. We were supposed to notify the Guild and let them do the job.”

“If we went back to let the Guild know, this man here would be dead!”

“Who cares if he dies. Do you even realise how much more your life weighs compared to him?”

There are two sounds that seem to be arguing with each other.

One is a deep man sound while the other is a familiar lady's voice that I heard before I fainted.

“You don’t know that! Didn’t you see his Blessing?” She argued.

“What? A sword? There are tons of others out there who have this type.”

“It’s not just a sword! It’s the sword from…” She suddenly stopped.

“Hey, he wakes up.” The man interrupted.

Both of them turn their attention to me as she quickly walks over.

“You’re awake?” She spoke softly.

“…”

She has clear blue eyes and beautiful smooth silver hair tied up in a knot shape behind.

She smiles at me. A smile that feels like it can even melt the ever-lasting ice.

No, stop. I will not be tricked anymore. Not for the third time!

“Sorry that we took so long to come. Please forgive us.”

“No… It was me who needed to thank you…” I tried my best to reply despite the pain.

“Thanks… for saving me.” I continued.

“You better be grateful.” The man snorted at me.

Looking at it, he’s a middle-aged man with an area of grey hair mixed with faded black. I guess he’s in his mid forty.

His attitude reminds me of the saying that the older a ginger gets, the spicier it becomes.

“Don’t worry about him. I’m just glad that you’re alright.”

The girl pulls up a chair and sits beside me.

“My name is Ciarra, and the man behind me is Amandus. Nice to meet you.” She spoke.

“Nice to meet you too.” I replied.

Since she formally introduces herself, I feel that I was supposed to do the same but I just don’t feel like opening up to anybody anymore.

“Brat. She already introduced herself first. It’s your turn now. Who are you?” The man asked.

“...” I ignored him.

“Stop it, Amandus.”

So the girl’s name is Ciarra and the man’s name is Amandus.

“I’m sorry to ask you this since you only just got up.” She tried to be as polite as possible.

“Go ahead.” I replied.

“How did you possess that Blessing?”

“Do you mean the sword?”

“Yes. The black sword that you used to fence back the Hellspawn.”

“I don’t know. It was just there.”

“Are you kidding me? What do you mean it was just there?” Amandus slowly loses his patience.

“I understand that you may want to keep it a secret, but this is an urgent matter. Your cooperation can save this kingdom.” Ciarra stops him.

“No… Seriously, I do not know. I thought I was going to die and suddenly, the sword appeared.” I replied.

“I see… So you have only just awoken your Blessing.”

“I’m sorry but can you elaborate more about this? What exactly is a Blessing?”

“...”

Both of them look at me in confusion, or rather, in a bit of shock.

“You don’t know what a Blessing is?” She asked again to clarify.

“Yes. I’m new around here.” I replied.

“As if. Everybody in the world knows that a Blessing is. Stop it, milady. This guy is just playing tricks on us.” Amandus argued.

“Amandus.” She stared right at him as if she wanted to remind him of his position.

He pouted and looked away. What a pain…

“A Blessing is a gift bestowed to us by the Above. It grants us the ability to fight back against the monstrous creatures called Hellspawn. You encountered one yesterday.”

“Is it similar to magic?”

“Not exactly. Magic, from many fantasy books, is meant to be many forms of spells and abilities, whether Blessing is a very focused ability that is bound to the individual.”

I can’t believe that they consider magic as fantasy yet Blessing a natural thing, but thinking about it in their perspectives, it kinda makes sense.

“To make an example, if a person’s Blessing is Fire Manipulation, that person cannot control any other element, such as water or wind.”

“I see. Does Blessing require mana to be used?”

“Oh, it’s good that you are aware of mana. To answer your question, no, it does not, but the Blessing’s effect is greatly affected by the mana pool within the individual.

Those who have low or almost no mana can still use their Blessing in the most basic form, such as a tiny flame on the finger. 

The reason is because mana already exists around us so it can be absorbed into the initiation of Blessing.”

“I see. Thanks for the explanation. It’s very clear.” I appreciated her mini lecture.

“No worries.” She replied.

After a brief pause, she continues.

“Our kingdom is in danger.”

“I beg your pardon?” I replied.

“The kingdom has been overrun by Hellspawns for a while, but now, the situation has escalated even further. The Hellspawns had infiltrated the royals and took control over Dawnguard, our capital city.

I know you might not believe me at first, but it is true. To prevent them from spreading their influence further, I need help from strong individuals.”

So, they call this kingdom by the name of Velder and Dawnguard as the capital city.

However, what is she trying to do by asking the guy who got tricked twice on the same day to help?

If she was the first one to approach me yesterday, I would have believed her.

“We’ve been following you since you first stepped into the town.”

“What?” I responded.

“We saw you were cornered by some bad guys, and were saved by a mysterious woman. Shortly after going inside the inn, we saw her carrying a large bag back out so we decided to follow her. That was how we ended up finding you and that Hellspawn in the cave.”

“You saw me going through all of that and you didn’t do anything to prevent it from happening?”

I know I sounded ridiculous but I went through a roller coaster of pain and betrayals that could have been prevented.

“Sorry.”

“Sorry? I could have died there.”

In my mind, I know that it’s not something I should say to my saviour but I just could not hold down my frustration.

“You!” Amandus tried to silent me but Ciarra held him back.

“We thought you could have handled it.”

“Handle it? How?”

“I’m not sure if you’re even aware of it, but you possess an incredibly huge mana pool.”

“...”

“I cannot estimate exactly how large it is. We can only measure the amount of mana that is not too different from our own.

I was not able to measure your mana pool so I could only assume that you were stronger than me. I’m sorry.” She apologised deeply.

“It’s fine. Don’t worry about it. I survived anyway thanks to your help in the end.” I brushed it off.

“Ungrateful bastard.” Amandus murmured.

He was right. I am an ungrateful bastard, but I don’t care. 

Since my previous life, I was always used by others around me. Even when I came here, I was betrayed twice on the first day.

I bet that the reason why these two saved me was so that they could recruit me into their kingdom-saving game.

“Anyway, I need to go. Have a good day.”

I stand up and plan to leave.

“What?” She spoke up in surprise.

“Wait.” She called out.

“What? I already thanked you for saving my life, but I don’t have anything else to offer or repay you with.” I replied.

“No, it’s not about that. My request. You haven’t given me the answer.” She asked while still looking confused.

See. At the end of the day, they only wanted something from me again.

“I decline.” I coldly replied.

I’m not going to let others take advantage of me anymore.

Moreover, I don’t even know what’s going on in this world, nevertheless for the kingdom’s sake.

All I need right now is a place where I can find my peace of mind.

“Why? You have potential. You just haven’t fully utilised your Blessing yet.”

I don’t know why she’s asking this as if it’s not obvious.

Does she actually believe that everybody loves their kingdom to the point of risking their lives?

I don’t know about others but I am not the hero that you’re looking for.

“It’s troublesome.” I replied and left.

Seeing me leaving, she doesn’t speak another word.

And now, I’m out.

Weird things keep happening around me.

I’m still trying to process what’s been happening after all.

Based on what she said earlier, this kingdom must be in a terrible state already with monsters called Hellspawns running freely everywhere.

Now it’s even worse because the capital city, where I assume is the safehold of many kingdoms, is overtaken by Hellspawns.

Moreover, how could a Hellspawn even infiltrate the city? Does it kill some humans and take over the bodies?

But what about Maria’s case? She was a human, but she tried to feed a Hellspawn.

She mentioned that she wanted it to kill everyone so I guess she must have some kind of grudge against the people in this town or the entire human race in general.

Talking about Maria, did she get away?

Neither Ciarra or Amandus mentioned about her so maybe they weren’t able to catch her after defeating the Hellspawn.

If she’s still around, it’s best if I can quickly find a safe place to stay around.

Well, Ciarra’s offer doesn’t sound too bad now if this is the case as she has the power to protect me. I assume Amandus may also have something similar.

Ah… I look at myself and realise that I now have a plain white shirt. I see that they not only saved me, but also gave me something.

Now I feel like a spoiled brat, but a man gotta keep his conviction. If I walk back, I would look like a total loser.

!!!

Loud noise can be heard from afar.

I wonder what’s going on. Let’s take a look.

What’s in front of me is the town’s folks standing by the side, opening a wide path in the middle.

It’s a marching of the knights.

These knights in heavy armour are around thirty five to forty in number.

Leading them is a man with an armour set that seems to be of higher class than the ordinary knights.

I don’t know the actual ranking but I can still tell from the pattern of the armour and the light reflected from it.

His armour fully covers his entire body and face so no one can tell what he looks like.

Meanwhile, there’s a lady behind him with short and curly red hair.

It seems that she’s quite attractive as I notice several men unable to take their eyes off her.

She wields a cold smile and doesn’t even bother looking back at those lustful men.

!!!

Suddenly, she glances at me.

I quickly look away. That was dangerous.

I swear I did not look at her with the same eyes as those guys. It was just out of curiosity.

When I realise, the rest of the knights have already marched on.

“Phew.” I blew off with a sign of relief.

Anyway, I need a place to stay for the night. Let’s head over to an inn.

I wonder how much a night costs in this town.

Wait. I don’t have money.

No. No. No.

Why am I so stupid? How am I even going to survive without a single coin on me?

Okay. Calm down. Let’s think of a solution.

Ah! Ciarra and Amandus.

I guess my conviction only lasted for a few minutes.

I quickly head back and to my surprise, I meet those knights again.

But this time, they are… surrounding the inn that I just left?

So, what she said earlier was all true, wasn’t it?

The higher-ups must have caught up to her now.

I can imagine she gets labeled as a rebel, then gets dragged outside to the public and executed.

She might even have been killed inside the inn along with Amandus.

I’m sorry, girl. I cannot help you. 

I don’t know why but I feel bad about it. I know if I was to agree to help her, by now I would have met the same fate.

However, knowing what she said was true builds up a sense of guilt in my heart.

It can’t be helped. I’m not a hero after all.

!!!

Just as I turn around, someone grabs me to a corner of the building.

“Who…”

“Shhh…” The person signaled me to be quiet.

With your hand covering my mouth, I don’t have a choice anyway.

“It’s me.” He spoke.

Now I know who the kidnapper is--- Amandus.

“They got Ciarra. Please come with me. I will explain.”

Even though I knew it would be dangerous, I still followed him.

“I beg you. Please help me to save her.” He continued after we walked for a while.

“How did you even get out?”

“She let herself be captured so I could sneak out.”

“Where are they going to take her?”

“It’s that tall building over there.”

I look to where Amandus is pointing at and see the town hall sticking out from the rest of the blocks.

“I know you have refused to join us, but please. Just once. Just this time only. Please help me.” Amandus begged me.

It caught me by surprise actually. I did not expect him to lower his pride in front of me.

“Please tell me what happened.” I asked.

As if my words are taken for an approval, Amandus quickly explains the details.

“These are the imperial knights from the Central. They were sent after us.

We’ve gotten away from them several times before they noticed us but they still managed to find us here.

Their mission is to find Ciarra and bring her back to Dawnguard.”

“Why do they need to bring her back to Dawnguard?”

“Because she’s the kingdom’s only princess and third child of the late king. The royalty wants to keep her in check.”

“She’s a princess?!”

I’m quite shocked to hear that.

I cannot imagine myself meeting a princess in such a rural area.

I know there are stories where the royalty members travel to these towns to build up their reputation but seeing a princess running away from the capital is a first for me.

Especially when the ones who are trying to capture her are her own family members.

“Please keep her identity a secret. I know it’s been exposed to the knights, but letting others know about this later on will only bring troubles to us.” Amandus warned me.

“Later on? You sound like you’re very confident in saving her.”

“I wasn’t, but now when I’m with you, I am.”

“How strong do I look in your eyes to give such a high evaluation of me?”

“Strong… enough to hold your own against a Hellspawn.”

“…”

I wouldn’t call that ‘holding my own’, more like getting my ass kicked around.

“We don’t have much time to waste. Let’s go over the details.”

Amandus then proceeds to explain the plan he has in his mind.

Firstly, the town hall has a basement which is rarely used, but its main purpose is to hold the bad guys since there is a lack of a prison here.

Secondly, he knows a secret passage that leads to that area from outside.

I’m surprised he even knows this.

But thinking about how careful they need to be, it shouldn’t be a surprise anymore.

The last step is to free Ciarra and escape from the same passage.

The last step sounded way too simple for such a dangerous task.

“What about the knights? Won’t they be guarding?” I asked.

“They will, but with this, we can ensure our escape.”

He shows a rounded object.

“This is a smoke bomb. When used, it will create smoke that covers the enemies’ vision. The prison area is narrow, they won’t be able to easily attack, otherwise, they will hurt each other.”

“I see.”

That’s a… solid plan, if nothing goes wrong.

He seems experienced with it. Maybe I can trust him.

“When do we start?”

“Tonight.”

Night arrives, and it’s time for action.

We are currently inside the secret passage.

It turns out the entrance for this passage is in the outskirts of the town. No wonder why this town is so messed up.

“What’s our princess like?” I asked.

I want to know. I’m curious, and it’s been quiet the entire time. Quietness can build up stress.

“You’ve already met her.” Amandus replied.

“I know, but I don’t know much about her. What’s her background, personality and usual activity?”

“Save it and ask her instead after getting her out.”

“…”

He must be fun at the party.

We arrive at the exit of the passage, which shall link to the air tunnel above the prison room.

Seriously, are they keeping a Hellspawn inside or something that they need such a huge passage for just an air tunnel?

Actually I should keep my thoughts away or I might really jinx this.

“Wait here.” Amandus whispered.

We calmly observe the situation of the room, scanning the surroundings.

We notice Ciarra is chained up behind the iron bars.

Opposite to her is the red-haired woman sitting down on a chair. It’s one of the knight people that I saw earlier.

“When are you going to return to us, milady?” The woman spoke.

“Never!” Ciarra strongly answered.

She’s a tough girl for someone this age.

How many people in this world can speak up to their opponent in a captured state?

“I know it might not feel right at first, but once you’ve joined us, you will see the world in an entire different way. I guarantee you it will be much more beautiful than the current filthy one.”

“This world is beautiful as it is.”

“Such stubbornness.” The woman shook her head.

“Anyway, enjoy your time here. Once Bryan returns, he will deal with you.”

The red-haired woman walks off.

We wait a little longer, making sure that she really has left.

“Let’s go.”

Amandus lifts off the door and we jump down.

“Amandus?” Ciarra spoke in surprise.

“Milady, we’ve come to save you.” Amandus responded.

“Him too?” She asked.

I nodded.

“I see. Thanks.”

“Leave it for later.” I replied.

I cut the iron bars with my black sword and then the iron chains on Ciarra.

“Watch out!”

!!!

I got smashed by something huge and was sent flying off to the wall. The pile of bricks crumbled over me.

“Look what we have here.” The red-haired woman returned and spoke in a charming tone.

“How did you know we are here? I thought you had left.” Amandus asked.

“Do you think I cannot sense the unusual mana source sneaking around? I left on purpose to lure you guys out.”

“Princess, I will delay her time while you escape through the air tunnel.” Amandus turned around and told Ciarra.

“What about you?” She asked.

“I’ll catch up after.”

“No, you can’t. She’s too strong for you.”

“I’ll be fine.”

Amandus does not want to waste any more time and turns around to face the red-haired woman.

“Surrender or die under the kingdom’s blade!” Amandus proudly shouted.

“I’m surprised you still declare the name of the kingdom’s blade even though it died a long time ago.” She mocked him.

“Honour never dies!”

Amandus charges forward and swings his sword at her. However, she stops his sword with her bare hand.

Actually, it’s a giant dark brown-red and wood-like hand.

Amandus pulls out his sword, leaving a cut on her palm.

“How dare you?!”

she angrily swings its other arm, which is now a giant trunk.

It sends Amandus flying back to the iron bars.

It seems like she has a Blessing to transform her body part to a tree.

“Princess, why are you still here? I told you to go!”

Amandus realised that Ciarra was still behind him and shouted.

“I… I can’t. I can’t leave you here.” She cried.

“Stop with the chit chat.”

The woman slams down its trunk-like arm, forcing Amandus to push Ciarra away.

He took that hit pretty hard and now his lower body is in bad shape.

He grabs the smoke bomb and throws it to the ground. It instantly releases a thick smoke that covers everything.

“Now go.” 

Amandus whispered to Ciarra behind him.

“Petty trick.”

The woman swings her arm powerfully to create wind that pushes away the smoke, clearing the room almost immediately.

To think that the smoke bomb would become so useless in front of her.

“You, milady, can be kept alive, but him…” The woman shook its head.

“Not too fast.”

I said that while getting out from the pile of bricks.

“Oh… You’re still alive?” The woman responded.

“Hero never dies.” I replied.

I know it’s such a cringey line to say, but to me, it still sounds so cool.

She swings its trunk-like arm at me, and I must say, the range it covers is really long.

I duck and slide forward while summoning my sword, then swing upward, cutting that trunk off.

“Arghhh!” It grunted.

I continue to press forward while it uses the other arm to stop me, but I cut it up too.

However, before I manage to get closer, huge sharp thorns appear from the ground and nearly stabs all over me.

Even though I avoided the attack, those thorns still grazed my legs and limited my movements.

“Impressive ability? Now I know how you managed to survive the earlier attack.” She mockingly said.

“...”

I don’t want to waste my breath in answering. I need to focus.

I don’t know why Ciarra isn’t using any ice attacks on her but I assume those chains on her are preventing her from doing so.

The woman doesn’t want to give me too much room to think and decides to attack me.

I somehow dodge both of its arms and thorns.

It feels like my body is slowly getting used to combat, almost as if it moves on its own.

She tries to retreat while building up a wooden shield.

I cut it open and do a roundhouse kick to her face.

“How dare you!” She angrily shouted.

She tries to retaliate with both of her trunk-like arms flying towards me.

I roll away from the attack and find myself in front of Amandus and Ciarra.

The surrounding suddenly starts shaking. Her attack just then must have destroyed the footholds.

“DIE!!!” She wanted to wrap things up.

However, I notice a few pieces of loose rocks falling around her spot.

I swing my sword as hard as I can and throw it towards the ceiling above her.

That pushes the shattered ceiling one last time and causes it to rain down large pieces of rocks over the woman.

Before she could respond, she was already buried by the rocks.

“Impressive.” Ciarra spoke up.

“Let’s quickly get out of here.” Amandus said.

“Old man, you’re still alive?” I said in a mocking tone.

“...”

The three of us get out together, with me carrying Amandus on my back since he cannot move freely.

We follow the same way we came in and arrive at the outskirts of the town.

We run further into the forest to gain a distance first.

Then we find a comfortable place to rest so that we can treat Amandus’s wounds.

I wonder if I have accidentally killed the woman earlier. I just wanted to hold her down so I hope nothing bad happened.

!!!

Suddenly, something lands ahead of us, crashing into the ground. He wears a heavy silver armour all over his body.

If I recall, I think his name is Bryan.

“Were you the one who did that?” Bryan asked.

If he’s talking about me burying his ‘lover’ then he’s right.

“No?” I replied.

I can see a few veins popped up on his forehead upon hearing that.

That woman must be his partner and I’m sure he wants to avenge her.

But it’s not like… she died, right?

He unsheathes his sword and his armour transforms, becoming thinner and more suited for fast combat.

That looks sick!

Anyway, he’s mad now.

I also summon my black sword and prepare myself for the clash.

Lucky me that my theory of summoning the sword again works, otherwise I wouldn’t have dared to throw it away earlier.

We charge at each other and exchange attacks.

One after another, our swords cross each other and the sound of metal clashing echoes through the forest.

He’s fast. Faster than all the opponents I faced before. However, I’m keeping up with his agility.

We enter a deadlock as our swords’ hand guards grip on each other.

!!!

Suddenly, his gauntlet transforms and stabs me on the shoulder.

I immediately try to kick him, but his chest piece grows out spikes and now my foot is full of holes.

“Argh…” I grunted.

It hurts.

Even though I can quickly recover, but everytime it happens, I still feel the pain.

I look at him again, but his armour has returned to its original shape.

He can manipulate his armour.

“What did you do?” I asked.

“...”

He didn’t answer.

I want to delay for a few seconds so I can think of a way out.

I cannot beat him. I concluded.

I was only at an equal pace earlier, if any slower, I might get killed.

Yes, I can get killed, again. No surprises here.

Without waiting, he attacks me again.

I blocked the first few strikes, but now I’m starting to struggle.

He deals another two quick cuts on my other shoulder and cheek.

This guy is dangerous. He’s seriously aiming only at my neck.

What can I do?

I need to focus. I cannot beat him, but what about the other two?

Amandus is dead-ass useless, but Ciarra is still in well-shape.

If I can get rid of the chains on her, maybe she can release her Blessing. But… am I even sure that it was the cause?

!!!

His constant attacks keep me away from focusing. I don’t even have a moment to gain my footing properly.

He thrusts his sword at me, but I manage to block its hand guard, preventing it from piercing through my neck.

!!!

His sword extends!

I quickly move my head aside, and it leaves a shallow cut on my neck.

That was so close. If I was more careless, my head would be rolling on the ground right now.

Looking back, he’s now wielding a spear. So, his armour isn’t the only thing he can transform.

He swings his spear around skillfully, as if he’s adapting into a spearman stance.

I don’t think I have any other choice.

He dashes toward me with a flurry of thrusts. I can sense this spear passing by my neck several times.

I bend down to dodge one more thrust and now I have my chance. I grab a handful of sand and throw it at his eyes.

“You shameful bastard!” he groaned.

He falls back to gain a better footing on me.

I can feel his vision getting worse so I immediately rush towards Ciarra.

“Watch out!” She shouted.

I leaped forward and barely avoided a spear thrown from him.

“Hands!” I yelled at her.

As if she immediately understands what I want, she lifts both her arms up to give me a clean opening on the wrist chains.

I cut down the chains.

“Ice Wall!”

When I turn around, I see a giant ice wall blocking the silver spear from reaching us.

“Hah…” I gave out a sign of relief.

“You don’t have to do this, milady.” Bryan said.

“Did you just seriously call her that? You imprisoned her just a while ago.” I mocked him.

“...”

It looks like I hit the spot.

“Return to where you came from, Bryan.” Ciarra announced.

“Don’t force me to do this.” He replied.

“Ice Lance.”

She casts several ice lances towards him.

“Tsk…” He grit his teeth.

He transforms his silver spear into a shield, breaking off any ice lance that flies towards him.

Ice starts to form on his feet, but before it can trap him, the spiky silver expands from his boots to break off the ice.

His shield now transforms back into a sword as he dashes toward us.

Ciarra fires off a few more ice lances but he dodges half of them and breaks the other half.

When he’s about to reach her, I come out from the side and stab him on the waist, causing him to lose his balance and fall back to the other side.

“Now, Ciarra!” I shouted.

“Icicle Crash.”

He immediately transforms his sword to a shield again to block the attacks from above.

He looks at me and realises that I’m already in a swinging position, readying to throw my sword at him.

He looks down on his waist as if he does not believe that the sword which was still stuck in him a second ago, has now returned to me.

I throw my sword straight at him.

He tries to lower the shield to block it, but Ciarra’s ice attacks pressure him even further.

!!!

My sword pierces his chest, causing him to collapse on his knees.

Ciarra also stops her attacks.

I did it. I won. I celebrated inside my head. Actually, more like we did it. Both she and I.

But… I killed someone. Perhaps two if the lady before couldn’t escape.

Did I have to? But if I didn’t, they would have killed me. However, my morals from the previous world still torments me in the thoughts of guilt.

“Are you okay?” It was Ciarra that pulled me back to reality.

“I killed a person.” I replied.

I assume that it may not be a big deal in this world so she may even find it odd for me to say such things.

“You didn’t. He’s still alive.”

“What? No, my sword pierced his heart.”

“His real body isn’t here. Look.”

I turn my attention towards whom I assume to be the remaining of Bryan but it’s now just a pool of silvery liquid.

“His Blessing allows him to create multiple versions of himself with a liquid similar to mercury. He would never risk his life coming out to a rural area.”

“But he reacted to my attacks and even lost his vision when I threw some sand at him?”

“When he wants to fully control his clone, he will synchronise his senses with it.”

“Ah… I see.” I let out a sigh of relief. 

“Are you guys okay?” I asked.

“We’re fine. Amandus managed to pass the critical stage.” Ciarra answered.

“I’m glad.”

“So… You’re coming with us?”

“Hah… Straight back to the business.” I laughed.

She smiles at me.

I guess my luck with the ladies recently is just ‘out of this world’, isn’t it?
